title: [BUG] SKCanvasView on MAUI only fires Pressed touch event
body:
I enabled touch events on the MAUI SKCanvasView, but only the Pressed action is coming through. You don’t even get the release action. No move actions either.


**Expected Behavior**

Touch events work

**Actual Behavior**

Only the pressed event fires

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  latest
- Last known good version:  none
- IDE:  VSMPreview
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - MacCatalyst:
- Target Devices:
  - Mac

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
You may have to set `e.Handled = true`, this is because you could opt to ignore touches without having to unsubscribe from events.

For example, assume you have a canvas that draws blocks and you want to drag the blocks. If the user taps on a block, you set `Handled = true` and then you get all the events. If the user taps the space, there is nothing more for you todo so you can do nothing or set `Handled = false` and you will not get any further events.

This was modeled after:

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.handledmouseeventargs.handled

> You will want to use [HandledMouseEventArgs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.handledmouseeventargs?view=windowsdesktop-6.0) primarily when developing a control that needs to handle mouse wheel events itself, and prevent them from being seen by the control's immediate parent container.

comments.author: yoshiask
comments.body: This seems like reasonable enough behavior, but what's odd to me is that not all platforms behave the same. The WinUI target works without setting `args.Handled`, but Android does not. I would expect the requirements to be consistent.
